newsitem.title: TURKEY: Istanbul gold trade booms amid free market demand.
newsitem.headline: Istanbul gold trade booms amid free market demand.

text.p: Istanbul gold trade boomed on Wednesday on the back of ample free market demand but prices remained steady due to quiet world markets, dealers said.
Traded volume jumped by 65 percent to 1,811 kilograms. Gold rose by $0.05 and 450 lira to end at $388.25 per ounce and 1,074,800 lira per gram.
Dealers said increased demand from the free market had caused activity to enliven on the Istanbul Gold Exchange.
Free market demand has been lively for the past month and a half as jewellery sales have increased with the summer season and higher number of tourists.
There was 1,386 kilos of trade in the morning and 425 kilos in the afternoon.
Of the total trade, 65 percent was in lira terms and the rest in dollars. --Istanbul Newsroom, +90-212-275 0875
